author: andrew-vdb
body:
It works locally on my machine but not in azure website
I can run phyton, node in azure website but not powershell core

Use case 01:
01. I use .zip of powershell core
02. I extract it in directory
03. I call "pwsh.exe" from c# with System.Diagnostic.Process
04. No standard error, no standard output in azure website (works in my local machine)
Expected:
At least give some error so I know what is wrong

Use case 02:
Calling Powershell.Create() return null
Expected:
There should be a way in the api to point where powershell core installed

The problem:
I think powershell core is expected to be installed in the machine.
Expected:
It should be more portable

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@andrew-vandenbrink Thanks for your report! Please add $PSVersionTable in the description.

`pwsh` can not start if you removed standard environment variables.

comments.author: andrew-vdb

title: Unable to run pwsh in azure website (inside asp.net core)
